meanings.sent1: She always has a kvetchy attitude about everything.
meanings.sent2: The kvetchy customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: Even the sunny weather couldn't stop her from being kvetchy.
meanings.sent4: Her kvetchy nature was like a dark cloud hanging over the group.
meanings.sent5: The kvetchy tone in her voice made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Characterized by constant complaining or nagging
meanings.sent1: The kvetchy old man grumbled about the food at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: Her kvetchy behavior was starting to annoy her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave her a kvetchy look as if to say, 'Stop complaining.'
meanings.sent4: The kvetchy sound of the dripping faucet echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The kvetchy sound of the alarm clock was the worst way to wake up.
